platform.game.linkable

Class Exit

  • java.lang.Object
    • platform.game.Actor
      • platform.game.linkable.Exit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Actor>, Linkable

    public class Exit
extends Actor
implements Linkable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Level level
      Level to be loaded when the Exit is activated
      private boolean linkable
      Signifies whether the Exit has to begin the linking process
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      private Signal signal
      Used to store the Signal
      private Signal signalTemp
      Used to store the temporary signal while the Actor is in linking process with other Signals.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Exit(Box box, Level level, boolean linkable)
      Constructor where we do not tell whether it is linkable (then it is not linkable)
      Exit(Box box, Level level, Signal signal)
      Constructor where no signal is given (null is sent to the full constructor)
      Exit(Box box, Level level, Signal signal, boolean linkable)
      Full constructor
      Exit(Vector position, double size, Level level, Signal signal)
      Constructor proposing a vector and a size instead of a Box

    • Constructor Detail

      • Exit

        public Exit(Box box,
            Level level,
            Signal signal,
            boolean linkable)
        Full constructor
        Parameters:
        box - Position and size parameters of the Exit.
        level - Level where which the Exit leads. If the level is null, create a default level
        signal - Signal linked to the Exit.
        linkable - Indicates whether the Exit needs to be linked or not.

      • Exit

        public Exit(Vector position,
            double size,
            Level level,
            Signal signal)
        Constructor proposing a vector and a size instead of a Box
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the Exit
        size - Size of the Exit
        level - Level where which the the Exit leads.
        signal - Signal linked to the Exit.

        level - Level where which the the Exit leads.
        signal - Signal linked to the Exit.

        level - Level where which the the Exit leads.
        linkable - Indicates whether the Exit needs to be linked or not.

      • getPriority

        protected int getPriority()
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Classification criteria for all Actors. Has to be defined by each and everyone of them. This method makes this class abstract, so non instantiable.
        Specified by:
        getPriority in class Actor
        Returns:
        an integer used to classify all Actors by importance.

      • copie

        Description copied from class: Actor
        Returns a "copy ready" instance of Actor
        Overrides:
        copie in class Actor
        Returns:
        a new instance of the same Actor. Used in button.Spawn. Null by default.
        See Also:
        Spawn

      • register

        public void register(World world)
        The following method has to be overridden to register all the signals it contains so it can be loaded in the new world and be visible.
        Overrides:
        register in class Actor
        Parameters:
        world - Instance of world which will be linked to the Actor.
        See Also:
        Simulator
